TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit DesignerDataSourceView extends System.Object

summary.span: Serves as the base class for design-time data source view classes.

span.span: Serves as the base class for design-time data source view classes.

remarks.format: ## Examples En el ejemplo de código siguiente se muestra cómo crear una personalizada objeto junto con un personalizado clase y personaliza dos clases.The following code example shows how to create a custom object along with a custom class and two custom classes. Este ejemplo forma parte de un ejemplo más extenso para el clase.This example is part of a larger sample for the class. [!code-csharp[DataSourceDesignerSample#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/DataSourceDesignerSample/CS/DataSourceDesignerSample.cs#2)] [!code-vb[DataSourceDesignerSample#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/DataSourceDesignerSample/VB/DataSourceDesignerSample.vb#2)] [!code-csharp[DataSourceDesignerSample#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/DataSourceDesignerSample/CS/DataSourceDesignerSample.cs#5)] [!code-vb[DataSourceDesignerSample#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/DataSourceDesignerSample/VB/DataSourceDesignerSample.vb#5)]

para.span: Al heredar de la (clase), es necesario reemplazar el método cualquiera para crear datos de ejemplo que se ajustan a la propiedad, o para devolver datos reales del origen de datos.

span.span: When you inherit from the class, you must override the method either to create sample data that conforms to the property, or to return real data from the data source.

summary.span: Generates design-time data that matches the schema of the associated data source control using the specified number of rows, indicating whether it is returning sample data or real data.
